content:
Sure, here are some examples of similar phrases to start open-ended questions:

1. "Can you tell me more about your current process/strategy for dealing with..."
2. "What steps do you think should be taken to address..."
3. "How do you see this impacting your business in the long run?"
4. "What are the biggest obstacles you see in implementing a solution for..."
5. "Can you share any examples of similar challenges you have dealt with in the past and how you approached them?"
6. "What resources do you have available to tackle this issue?"
7. "What are the potential risks and benefits of different approaches to solving this problem?"
8. "What are your main priorities when it comes to addressing this challenge?"
9. "What kind of support do you think would be most beneficial in addressing this issue?"
10. "How do you see this issue impacting your company's overall goals and objectives?"
